comment._content: Those young ladies could be yachties?

comment.author: 33147718@N05
comment._content:
[http://www.flickr.com/photos/angeljim46] They do look as though they could be in yachting attire don't they? 
[http://www.flickr.com/photos/antonio_campofreddo] Thank you!
comment.authorname: Australian National Maritime Museum on The Commons

comment.author: 33147718@N05
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/angeljim46] Andy we found an image of Mrs Stuart Doyle crowning the Queen of the Harbour on Clark Island in 'Sailing' magazine, vol 7, no 14, January 1931. In the photograph many of the same ladies appear, dressed in the same clothes. SMH has an article on the 1931 Queen of the Harbour comp.
comment.authorname: Australian National Maritime Museum on The Commons

comment.author: 55198937@N05
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/anmm_thecommons]  Thanks anmm. The Queen of the Harbour looks like a nautically-inspired dress/beauty competition. "27 neatly-attired young ladies" indeed!
